main event: On August 8, 1952, between 2010 and 2115 hours, visual sightings of unidentified flying objects were reported to the 2nd Air Division Control Center at Barksdale AFB, Louisiana. The objects were observed by approximately 12 officers and airmen, giving the appearance of intense white lights and exhibiting erratic behavior such as abrupt stops and changes in direction. Radar equipment at the base was unable to track the objects, and there were no known aircraft capable of the observed maneuvers.
interesting points: The objects were seen at an estimated altitude of 10,000 to 15,000 feet and moving at a speed estimated to be in excess of 500 mph.
Observers reported that the objects appeared to be solid and circular in shape, and made no sound.
There was no sound associated with the objects, and they were reported to have made abrupt stops and changes in direction.
The duration of the sightings was approximately 15 to 30 minutes.
The report was unable to determine a conclusive explanation for the observed objects.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects with intense white lights
